decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly ramping up with Cloudposts and other lands to cast big colorless threats like Ulamog and Emrakul. It also includes tools like Karn, the Great Creator and Crop Rotation to search for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats and control elements, utilizing its ramp and combo potential to quickly close out games. It also includes cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Karn's Sylex to disrupt graveyard strategies and artifact-based decks, making it a versatile and strong option in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to establish early board control through aggressive plays using powerful artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. By utilizing mana acceleration and disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, the deck aims to lock down opponents while quickly developing a threatening board presence with dragons and other powerful creatures like Pyrogoyf. The deck's goal is to overwhelm opponents with a combination of powerful threats and disruptive elements, leading to a quick victory.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with high-power creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. With cards like Chalice of the Void and Wastescape+Battlemage','','');">Wastescape Battlemage to disrupt opponents' strategies, this deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting opponents' game plans. The inclusion of cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal allows for explosive starts, while Cavern of Souls and Eye of Ugin provide additional mana-fixing and searching capabilities. With a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to quickly close out games and overpower opponents in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to apply pressure quickly and disrupt the opponent's game plan through aggressive creature plays, disruption spells, and versatile planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending, while utilizing cards like Spell Pierce and Force of Will to protect its threats. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful enchantments like Back to Basics and Dress Down further disrupts the opponent's strategy, allowing the deck to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using disruptive spells and creatures to control the game while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent. The deck aims to tempo out opponents by using countermagic and removal spells to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Utilizing cards like Daze and Force of Will to protect its creatures, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the deck utilizes fetch lands and Wasteland to ensure consistency in mana development and disruption of opponent's mana base.

This combo deck aims to use Mystic Forge to cast artifacts from the top of the library, generating a large amount of mana with cards like Basalt Monolith and Grim Monolith. The deck also includes key pieces like Tezzeret, Karn, and Ugin to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies. By combining powerful artifacts and efficient mana generation, the deck can quickly assemble a winning board state or combo off for a game-ending play. The abundance of mana rocks and artifacts enable explosive plays and powerful synergies to dominate the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently empty your library, using various spells and creatures like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy, in order to win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces as quickly as possible, utilizing cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to accelerate its game plan. The deck also includes disruption tools like Pact of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect its combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck aims to win the game by milling the opponent's entire library in one turn and then using a creature like Thassa's Oracle to win on the spot. It utilizes a combination of fast mana acceleration cards, creatures that mill cards from the opponent's library, and protection spells to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The key is to carefully manage resources and timing to execute the combo effectively and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to disrupt the plan.

The deck focuses on using control elements like counterspells and removal alongside efficient creatures to maintain board control and tempo. The Stoneforge Mystic package provides valuable equipment to enhance the creatures' abilities, while cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix offer added utility. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Phelia further enhances the deck's control aspects. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and includes utility lands like Karakas. Overall, the deck aims to out value and outlast opponents through efficient card advantage and well-timed disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly generating a large amount of mana with cards like Lion's Eye Diamond, Dark Ritual, and Cabal Ritual to then cast a powerful combo spell like Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in a single turn. The inclusion of Wishclaw Talisman adds consistency by allowing the player to search for key combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo, as well as Veil of Summer to protect against counterspells. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure smooth mana production.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back into play with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to win through a combination of fast creature deployment and control elements to protect its combo pieces.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. The combination of efficient card draw and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will allows the player to protect their combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a mix of threats like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to apply pressure on the opponent while setting up the reanimation combo.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. This allows the player to cheat expensive creatures into play and overwhelm their opponent early in the game. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a powerful reanimation strategy while controlling the board with counterspells and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty or Atraxa, and then bring them back into play using cards like Reanimate or Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Dauthi Voidwalker to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of card draw, interaction, and powerful threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and efficient combo strategy.
